step1.title: General health
step1.instructions: Take a multivitamin daily to support overall health and energy levels.

information.text: Multivitamins support energy by filling potential nutritional gaps.

step1.title: Get vitamin D test
step1.instructions: Get a blood test to measure your current vitamin D levels.
step1.startPrompt: Analyze the image and determine if it includes what's required for the goal 'vitamin D comprehensive'.

information.text: Testing helps understand your baseline vitamin D status.

step2.title: Supplement with vitamin D3
step2.instructions: Take vitamin D3 daily based on your test results.

information.text: Vitamin D3 supports immune function and bone health.

step3.title: Analyze vitamin D levels
step3.instructions: Review your vitamin D levels after 3 months of supplementation.
step3.startPrompt: Analyze the image and determine if it includes what's required for the goal 'vitamin D comprehensive'.

information.text: Learn what different vitamin D levels mean and how to interpret results.

step1.title: Sleep before 22:30
step1.instructions: Try going to bed before 10:30 PM each night to align with your body's natural circadian rhythm.

information.text: Early sleep supports melatonin cycles and recovery.

step1.title: Hormonal support
step1.instructions: Take magnesium in the evening to promote relaxation and hormonal balance.

information.text: Magnesium can improve sleep quality and regulate cortisol.

step1.title: Neuroregulation
step1.instructions: Use L-Theanine before bed to reduce anxiety and support deeper sleep.

information.text: L-Theanine promotes alpha brain waves for calm and focus.

step1.title: Calm alertness
step1.instructions: Take L-Theanine daily to promote calm focus and reduce distraction.

step1.title: Neurotransmitter support
step1.instructions: Support dopamine production with L-Tyrosine in the morning before mentally demanding tasks.

information.text: L-Tyrosine is a precursor to dopamine and supports cognitive function under stress.

step1.title: Cognitive stimulation
step1.instructions: Do brain training such as dual n-back or problem-solving exercises.

information.text: Mental exercises enhance working memory and neuroplasticity.

step1.title: Vitamin support
step1.instructions: Daily intake of vitamin C to enhance immune function.

information.text: Vitamin C is a powerful antioxidant that supports white blood cell function.

step1.title: Natural defense
step1.instructions: Take echinacea in the morning to boost your immune system.

information.text: Echinacea may reduce the duration of colds and enhance immune resilience.

step1.title: Glutathione & detox
step1.instructions: Support detoxification by supplementing with NAC.

information.text: NAC boosts glutathione, the body's master antioxidant.

step1.title: Adaptogens
step1.instructions: Take Ashwagandha once or twice daily to reduce cortisol and improve resilience.

information.text: Ashwagandha helps balance stress hormones and improve sleep quality.

step1.title: Calming agents
step1.instructions: Take glycine before bed to improve sleep and reduce anxiety.

information.text: Glycine acts as a calming neurotransmitter and enhances deep sleep.

step1.title: Neurochemical support
step1.instructions: Use Semax to regulate mood and support neurochemical balance.

information.text: Semax is a peptide that modulates brain chemistry and reduces fatigue.

step1.title: Basic support
step1.instructions: Take creatine daily to improve muscle strength and energy.

information.text: Creatine enhances ATP production for explosive strength.

step1.title: Aktivera fler motorenheter
step1.instructions: Take protein powder after workouts to support muscle recovery.

information.text: Fokuserad träning för att öka rekrytering av motoriska enheter och förbättra neuromuskulär effektivitet. Grunden för explosivitet och styrka.

step1.title: Endurance & recovery
step1.instructions: Supplement with beta-alanine to increase muscular endurance.

information.text: Beta-alanine buffers lactic acid, improving stamina.

step1.title: Hormonal boosters
step1.instructions: Use shilajit to support testosterone and physical performance.

information.text: Shilajit contains minerals and fulvic acid that support testosterone.

step1.title: Androgenic support
step1.instructions: Take Fadogia to support the body's natural testosterone production.

information.text: Fadogia may stimulate luteinizing hormone and testosterone levels.

step1.title: Gut flora & fiber
step1.instructions: Take probiotics before meals to support gut flora.

information.text: Probiotics help balance gut microbiota and support immunity.

step2.title: Nuts and seeds
step2.instructions: A new study from Zoe has identified a new bacterial strain, SGB15249, that may improve gut health. Individuals who included a daily serving of nuts and seeds were found to have this bacteria. Include a daily serving of nuts and seeds to increase fiber intake and support the microbiome.

step1.title: Liver & enzymes
step1.instructions: Take Milk Thistle to protect and support liver detoxification function.

information.text: Milk Thistle contains silymarin, known to support liver cell regeneration.

step1.title: Advanced gut support
step1.instructions: Use TUDCA daily to support bile flow and liver-gut health.

information.text: TUDCA improves bile acid flow and supports detoxification.

step1.title: HIIT 2x/week
step1.instructions: Do at least 2 HIIT workouts per week. Log your workouts in the app or via a connected device.
step1.startPrompt: The user has a goal to perform at least 2 high-intensity interval training (HIIT) sessions per week. Based on the workout log below, evaluate whether the goal was achieved. Summarize progress and give encouragement or advice.

information.text: HIIT boosts VO₂ max and supports fat metabolism.

step1.title: Increase running volume
step1.instructions: Gradually increase your weekly running distance. Use GPS data to track progress.
step1.startPrompt: The user is working to increase total running distance each week. Given the workout data, analyze if there's an upward trend. Mention any signs of overtraining or progress plateaus.

information.text: Increasing volume gradually helps build aerobic base safely.

step1.title: VO₂ max in 4 weeks
step1.instructions: Follow a structured cardio plan. Monitor VO₂ max data via Garmin or similar device.
step1.startPrompt: Evaluate the trend in VO2 max over the past month using the data below. Has the user improved? Offer encouragement or suggest changes to training based on results.

information.text: VO₂ max is a key marker of endurance capacity and aerobic health.

mind.title: Mind
mind.description: Explore heart–brain coherence and mental states

step1.title: Explore Heart–Brain Coherence
step1.instructions: Perform an HRV session where you test different mental states in sequence and compare the differences.
step1.startPrompt: Complete the session according to the steps below. Then take a picture of your HRV measurement and upload it.
step1.analyzePrompt: Analyze the uploaded image: How do heart rate, HRV, and the curve pattern differ between the steps?

information.text: Heart–Brain Coherence means that the rhythm of the heart becomes smooth and sinusoidal, sending calming signals to the brain. This can be achieved through conscious breathing and positive emotions.

tasks.task1: HRV measurement in baseline (sit still, do not think about anything specific).
tasks.task2: HRV measurement while thinking about something stressful or irritating.
tasks.task3: HRV measurement during recovery with calm breathing.
